calc_FWHM Submodule

This section provides documentation for the calc_FWHM.py submodule.

dopterianPlus.calc_FWHM.calc_1d_FWHM(psf_integrated, psf_abscissa)[source]

Calculate the 1D Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of a PSF profile.

Parameters:

  • psf_integrated (ndarray) – Integrated intensity of the PSF along a specific axis.

  • psf_abscissa (ndarray) – Pixel positions corresponding to the intensity values.

Returns:

The FWHM of the PSF profile along the given axis.

Return type:

float

Notes

  • The function determines the positions where the intensity is equal to half of the maximum value.

  • Linear interpolation is used to enhance the precision of the estimated FWHM.

dopterianPlus.calc_FWHM.calc_FWHM(psf_data, pixel_scale)[source]

Calculate the 2D Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of a PSF.

Parameters:

  • psf_data (ndarray) – 2D PSF data array. For 3D data with only one slice, the function automatically squeezes to 2D.

  • pixel_scale (float) – Pixel scale of the data in physical units (e.g., arcseconds per pixel).

Returns:

The FWHM of the PSF in physical units.

Return type:

float

Notes

  • The FWHM is computed as the average of the FWHMs along the x and y axes.
